title: Job Openings at Holy Trinity Hospital
content:
Holy Trinity Hospital, a leading Hospital is currently recruiting well qualified and experienced candidates to fill the following positions below:

1.) Radiologist / Sonographer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirement


	Certified Radiographer / Sonologist


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: holytrinityhospitals@ymail.com

 

 

2.) Dentist
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirement


	MDCN Certified. 


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: holytrinityhospitals@ymail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Senior Nurse

Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements


	Not less than 10 years of post qualification.
	Experience in a similar setting is an advantage .


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: holytrinityhospitals@ymail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted will be contacted     

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Registered Nurse and Midwife (Ibadan Resident only)",
  "description": "St. Dominic Catholic Hospital is a 64 bed hospital located in Ogungbade, off New Ife road Ibadan. St Dominic Catholic Hospital is the vision of the Dominican Sisters of St Catherine of Siena (Italy). We offer various medical services such as: General medicine, internal medicine, O &amp; G, Laboratory, and Radiology, to mention just a few. The hospital is run in collaboration with foreign partners. We are registered and licensed by the Corporate Affairs Commission and the Ministry of Health. Also, we are accredited by the NHIS as both primary and secondary healthcare providers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Registered Nurse and Midwife (Ibadan Resident only)

Job Location: Ibadan,&nbsp;Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Assess, plan, implement, and evaluate care for women during pregnancy, labor, delivery, and postpartum.
	Conduct prenatal and postnatal examinations.
	Provide education and support to women and their families on pregnancy, childbirth, and parenting.
	Take/Assist with deliveries and perform midwifery procedures as needed.
	Collaborate with obstetricians and other healthcare professionals to develop and implement care plans.
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of patient care.
	Participate in quality improvement initiatives to improve patient outcomes and satisfaction.
	Stay current with evidence-based practice and professional development.


Requirements


	Bachelor&#39;s Degree in Midwifery or a related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of work experience as a Registered Nurse Midwife.
	Current registration as a Registered Nurse / Midwife with the relevant professional body.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment.
	Commitment to patient-centered care and evidence-based practice.
	Resident in Ibadan (Iwo Road, New Ife Road axis).


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Application Letter to:&nbsp;adm.sdchib2019@yahoo.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2025-10-26",

Registered Nurse and Midwife (Ibadan Resident only) Job at St. Dominic Catholic Hospita




        
    

        
        St. Dominic Catholic Hospital is a 64 bed hospital located in Ogungbade, off New Ife road Ibadan. St Dominic Catholic Hospital is the vision of the Dominican Sisters of St Catherine of Siena (Italy). We offer various medical services such as: General medicine, internal medicine, O & G, Laboratory, and Radiology, to mention just a few. The hospital is run in collaboration with foreign partners. We are registered and licensed by the Corporate Affairs Commission and the Ministry of Health. Also, we are accredited by the NHIS as both primary and secondary healthcare providers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Registered Nurse and Midwife (Ibadan Resident only)
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Assess, plan, implement, and evaluate care for women during pregnancy, labor, delivery, and postpartum.
	Conduct prenatal and postnatal examinations.
	Provide education and support to women and their families on pregnancy, childbirth, and parenting.
	Take/Assist with deliveries and perform midwifery procedures as needed.
	Collaborate with obstetricians and other healthcare professionals to develop and implement care plans.
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of patient care.
	Participate in quality improvement initiatives to improve patient outcomes and satisfaction.
	Stay current with evidence-based practice and professional development.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Midwifery or a related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of work experience as a Registered Nurse Midwife.
	Current registration as a Registered Nurse / Midwife with the relevant professional body.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment.
	Commitment to patient-centered care and evidence-based practice.
	Resident in Ibadan (Iwo Road, New Ife Road axis).


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Application Letter to: adm.sdchib2019@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Social Media Manager Jo",
  "description": "Tespire is and Edutech company Incorparted to help school handle their management software.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time
Work Schedule: Hybrid (4 days onsite, 1 day remote)
Occasional travels: Yes

Job Summary


	The Social Media Manager will be responsible for developing and executing creative strategies to strengthen Tespire&rsquo;s brand presence across digital platforms and foster engagement with our target audience.
	This role requires the ability to communicate the value of intangible tech products and services, making complex solutions relatable, engaging, and shareable.
	The ideal candidate is both strategic and hands-on, with a proven ability to translate abstract product offerings into compelling social narratives that drive awareness, trust, and business growth.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement a results-driven social media strategy aligned with Tespire&rsquo;s business objectives.
	Manage and grow Tespire&rsquo;s presence across key platforms, including LinkedIn, Instagram, X (Twitter), Facebook, and emerging channels.
	Create and curate engaging, relevant, and shareable content that simplifies and promotes intangible products/services to diverse audiences.
	Plan, execute, and monitor paid social media campaigns to boost brand awareness and lead generation.
	Collaborate with product, design, and marketing teams to ensure messaging consistency across all channels.
	Track, analyze, and report on key social media metrics to measure ROI and improve campaign effectiveness.
	Monitor industry trends, competitor activities, and audience conversations through social listening tools.
	Foster meaningful interactions with online communities, influencers, and thought leaders to position Tespire as an industry authority.
	Train and support internal teams on best practices for brand advocacy through social platforms.


Experience


	Hands-on experience developing and executing social media campaigns.
	Skilled in creating, scheduling, and managing multi-format content (text, images, video, infographics).
	Experience with social media tools, such as:
	
		Analytics Tools: Google Analytics, Meta Business Suite, LinkedIn Analytics.
		Design Tools: Canva, Capcut, Adobe Creative Suite..
	
	
	Experience with social media advertising and paid campaign optimization.
	Prior experience in tech or intangible product marketing is a strong advantage.


Salary
N150,000 - N180,000 Monthly.",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-01",
  "validThrough": "2025-10-21",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Tespire"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Abuja",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "188183"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 150000,
      "maxValue": 250000,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Social Media Manager Jo at Tespire




        
    

        
        Tespire is and Edutech company Incorparted to help school handle their management software.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager
Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time
Work Schedule: Hybrid (4 days onsite, 1 day remote)
Occasional travels: Yes

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Social Media Manager will be responsible for developing and executing creative strategies to strengthen Tespire’s brand presence across digital platforms and foster engagement with our target audience.
	This role requires the ability to communicate the value of intangible tech products and services, making complex solutions relatable, engaging, and shareable.
	The ideal candidate is both strategic and hands-on, with a proven ability to translate abstract product offerings into compelling social narratives that drive awareness, trust, and business growth.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement a results-driven social media strategy aligned with Tespire’s business objectives.
	Manage and grow Tespire’s presence across key platforms, including LinkedIn, Instagram, X (Twitter), Facebook, and emerging channels.
	Create and curate engaging, relevant, and shareable content that simplifies and promotes intangible products/services to diverse audiences.
	Plan, execute, and monitor paid social media campaigns to boost brand awareness and lead generation.
	Collaborate with product, design, and marketing teams to ensure messaging consistency across all channels.
	Track, analyze, and report on key social media metrics to measure ROI and improve campaign effectiveness.
	Monitor industry trends, competitor activities, and audience conversations through social listening tools.
	Foster meaningful interactions with online communities, influencers, and thought leaders to position Tespire as an industry authority.
	Train and support internal teams on best practices for brand advocacy through social platforms.


Experience


	Hands-on experience developing and executing social media campaigns.
	Skilled in creating, scheduling, and managing multi-format content (text, images, video, infographics).
	Experience with social media tools, such as:
	
		Analytics Tools: Google Analytics, Meta Business Suite, LinkedIn Analytics.
		Design Tools: Canva, Capcut, Adobe Creative Suite..
	
	
	Experience with social media advertising and paid campaign optimization.
	Prior experience in tech or intangible product marketing is a strong advantage.


Salary
N150,000 - N180,000 Monthly.    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
